metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17459 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: http_transport.c in Fossil before 2.4, when the SSH sync protocol is used, allows user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via an ssh URL with an initial dash character in the hostname, a related issue to CVE-2017-9800, CVE-2017-12836, CVE-2017-12976, CVE-2017-14176, CVE-2017-16228, CVE-2017-1000116, and CVE-2017-1000117.

criterions.comment: fossil: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
